title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. The enclosed class serves as an example. To make the program correct, I need to add a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' function.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up the code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.
OB: When using code assist in the given circumstances, it replaces more code than expected.
EB: The code assist should only replace the necessary code for the 'baz' call, leaving the rest of the code intact.
SR:
1. Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up the code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.
